texts.value: Dimeric G protein-coupled receptor which is activated by the excitatory neurotransmitter L-glutamate (By similarity). Plays critical roles in modulating synaptic transmission and neuronal excitability. Upon activation by glutamate, inhibits presynaptic calcium channels, reducing further glutamate release and dampening excitatory signaling (By similarity). Mechanistically, ligand binding causes a conformation change that triggers signaling via guanine nucleotide-binding proteins (G proteins) and modulates the activity of down-stream effectors, such as adenylate cyclase. May mediate suppression of neurotransmission or may be involved in synaptogenesis or synaptic stabilization (By similarity)
Forms heterodimers with GRM3 or GRM4. Interacts with GNAI1 (By similarity). Interacts with TAMALIN (PubMed:11850456). Interacts with HTR2A (By similarity)
Is widely distributed in the CNS and prominent expression is seen in Golgi cells of the cerebellum and some particular neuronal cells in other brain regions
Belongs to the G-protein coupled receptor 3 family

citation.title: A family of metabotropic glutamate receptors.
Tamalin, a PDZ domain-containing protein, links a protein complex formation of group 1 metabotropic glutamate receptors and the guanine nucleotide exchange factor cytohesins.

properties.value: Expressed in frontal cortex and 3 other cell types or tissues
F:group II metabotropic glutamate receptor activity
P:G protein-coupled glutamate receptor signaling pathway
P:positive regulation of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase/protein kinase B signal transduction
P:presynaptic modulation of chemical synaptic transmission
